title: Great
review: This is one of the famous Lord Shiva temple in Agra. Many people's came here for worship daily infact those people's who came from another country they also came here for worship . Lord shiva always is great;

title: Divine!
review: I am a regular visitor of this temple whenever I go to Agra.This place gives peace and one must attend the aarti of bholenath.

title: Bolo Nath
review: Very good and very old Bholenath temple in Agra, lots of people visited herefrom Agra as well as outside of Agra.

title: Nice temple to visit with family
review: I was visited and found temple was beautiful and unique art. Must visit with family and kids. This is a famous in Agra.

title: No words
review: Since childhood I am going to this temple. One of the best place and Aarti of Bholenath is mind blowing. I strongly follower of this temple and always found peace as soon as I enter in this temple. Jai Shri Mankameshwar Nath

title: Very revered Shiva Temple
review: This is one of the oldest Lord Shiva temple . Local people and visiting tourists thron to this rare murti with devotion and enjoy Aarti in the evening . Monday's are always very crowded .

title: A must see temple!
review: 500 year old temple is a must see... it's got this power that can draws you to it. a lovely experience in a bustling market place

title: One of 4 important Hindu temples in Agra
review: One of the oldest shiv temple of agra located in the central of the city near red fort railway station

title: Bam Bam Bole
review: One of the few Hindu places among the many Muslim monuments of Agra. This temple is in a very congested place. We had to leave our car far behind. Beware of the monkeys. But its a peaceful temple.

title: Old Shiva Temple in Agra
review: This temple situated near Derasi No 1 Agra fort railway station .Local and outsider of agra visit this holy place regularly.

title: Agra's Oldest Temple of lord shiva🙏
review: Hey...traveller's 1st we all know about lord shiv soo My Dear Friends  if you are from agra or you visit agra and you want to see oldest temple so guys must visit mankameshwara temple in agra. It was a very old temple of shiv. All over worlds of shiv ji fan come this place for just to see lord shiva. I go their every Monday. Monday is the day of lord shiva.

title: Bam bam bhole
review: This is a baba bhole nath temple .

title: Temple of lord shiva
review: Temple is located near Agra Fort railway station in a highly congested market. Parking is a big problem. Streets leading to the temple are narrow and have shops of interest especially for ladies. Idol of lord Shiva is mesmerizing. Should visit.

title: shiv temple
review: shiv temple located in agra, very difficult to reach there as there it is a crowdy place. temple is for lord shiva.

title: Feeling Blessed!
review: Dedicated to Lord Shiva. Said to be created by him . Very popular but located in a very crowded place,

title: A famous Shiv temple
review: This is a very famous shiv temple. The atmosphere is so livid and exciting than one can stop himself in getting immersed in it. There is nothing much to do apart from going around and just experiencing the atmosphere and worshipping the lord shiva.

title: Jai shri mankameshwar baba...
review: Very nice atmosphere..its great to be with shri mankameshwar baba & shri nath ji...

title: Divine temple of Bholenath
review: Shri mankameshwar temple is a famous center for hindu devotees for worshipping Lord Shivji. Temple has strict timings of worship and is located in busy market area. Outside you can buy all necessary items for prayer. Main sanctum is home to Lord Shivji's statue. Rest of the temple houses various states of God and Goddesses.

title: Divine Temple!!!
review: Shri Mankameshwar Mandir is situated in Lahor Gali, Agra. The temple is very divine and Pleasant to visit. Lord shiva is the main god in this temple.

title: Must Visit Prachin Temple
review: Excellent Shivji Temple in the Old Part of Agra.

title: Mesmerizing Temple
review: People of Agra has deep faith in this temple. Beautiful temple. I went to this place few times earlier as well. But gathering is becoming more and more at this place. On every Monday there are more number of people specially during early morning. It would be better to avoid that road as it is very busy.

title: Har Har Mahadev
review: This temple is one of the oldest temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is a ritual in Mankameshwar temple that people must not wear leather items, salwaar suits, pyjamas and pants. People must wear traditional Indian attires only, that is dhoti and sari.

title: Let Your Heart Say- Har Har Mahadev
review: Shri Mankameshwar Mandir is considered as one of the holy temples in Agra, you should visit to get your wish fulfilled, and say a loud by your heart- Har- Har Mahadev.

title: More than 1000 year old Temple of Lord Shiva
review: A very religious place of Hindus. It has a shiv ling whose actual age is unknown. followers visit here mostly on Mondays to pray for to get their wishes fulfilled. A Annual fair is held here in the month of July when it is rainy reason in Agra.

title: Temple of Faith.
review: Shri Mankameshwar temple is an ancient temple and centre of faith among the locals. Specially it is visited on Mondays.

title: Religious place for hindus.
review: Mankameshwar temple is located on Daresi Road in agra. It is near to bijlighar crossing.This temple is temple of lord shiva. It is said one who prays to lord shiva and if one visit this temple lord shiva fulfill his or her wishes.

title: Om Namah Shivay
review: Ancient temple of lord Shiva and very famous in locals. It is said that who so ever pray at this temple and make a wish Lord shiva fulfills his/her wish. Great place for worshiping and meditation.

title: good place to meditate, keep clean
review: Beautiful and peaceful temple to visit, try to meditate for few hours if possible in it....

title: Family
review: It was good temple

title: OLD TEMPLE TURNED COMMERCIAL
review: This is very old temple of Lord Shiva in Agra but now they become truly commercial ,mandir is having lots of money but it is been use by its head priest and his family and even they are charging money from the devotees for performing rudra abhishek in the mandir ,which is very wrong

title: A place of peace midst Chaos
review: The temple foyer is in basement, it belongs to Shri Rudra roop of Shiva, surrounded by miniature temples of Shivling, krishna g. Ram g, Hanuman g, Ganesha g and.......The temple is located in mid chaos of market. Suggest to come via two wheeler or Rickshaw. No parking. A lot of Monkeys. But the temple is peaceful and different. Har Har MAHADEV.

title: Must Watch
review: An old shiv temple in the heart of old Agra. Must visit as the temple is very good and maintained properly.

title: "Famous Shiva temple in Agra"
review: Mankameshwar Temple in Agra is one of the ancient temples devoted to Lord Shiva. The temple is situated at Rawatpara, near Agra Fort Railway Station. It is said that the shivlinga is covered by the silver metal and was founded by Lord Shiva himself during Dwapara era, when krishna was born in mathura. For child krishna darshan Shiva arrived from mount kailash and rested here. Shamshaan(cremation ground) yamuna which used to flow here, Shiva meditated and night stayed at the Mankameshwar Temple.

title: Good Old Temple
review: This is a huge old temple in Agra and it is recorded in history as the oldest temple located in a narrow lane, amidst  the main market area of Agra. This temple is the abode of Lord Shiva. It is often told that Lord Shiva himself wished to appear here. The temple not only features Shivlinga , It also has the idol of Shiva Parviti.

title: jai baba mankameshwar :) good old temple
review: this is very old temple of lord shiva . according to history it is one of the oldest place in agra. this is huge temple in the main market of agra . the all gods statue is so lively that you are a deep fan on it. temple is full of spiritual energy.

title: Har har mahadev!
review: The best place to visit in Agra. You should visit this famous hindu temple, first, in agra before proceeding anywhere.

title: good temple of Shiva
review: this temple in Agra city is very famous among the Lord Shiva followers from around the world. It is estimated that ShivLing at this temple is almost 3500 years old.

title: Temple of Lord Shiva
review: This is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva near Agra Fort Railway Station/Jami Masjid. One has to descend down some stairs for DARSHAN. Here Shivlinga is permananetly covered by Silver tin and opens in some years. Last was opened in 1992. You have to offer pooja on covered shivlinga but to reach there Male has to wear Dhoti and Female to wear Saree. There are some more other mini temples around Shiv temple. A definately a Visitable temple like devotee of Lord Shiva like us.

title: Faith
review: Dedicated to Lord Shiva, this temple is to said that it was founded by Shiva himself. Located in a bit narrow lane area, it is one of the most respected temples in Agra. Lots of diyas are lighten up here by devotees. Nearby nice sweet shops.

title: Very Old Shiv temple with scents of Hinduism
review: Shri Mankameshwar Mandir is an old Hindu Temple of Bhagwan Shiv. This temple is the most famous temple of Agra among Hindu believers. Its location in the old streets of Agra is worth watching.

title: A Must Devotional visit while you are at Agra
review: Mankameshwar Mandir (Temple) in Agra is one of the ancient temples devoted to Lord Shiva. The temple is situated at Rawatpara, near Agra Fort Railway Station. It is said that the shivlinga is covered by the silver metal and was founded by Lord Shiva himself during Dwapara era, when krishna was born in mathura.

title: One of the ancient temples devoted to Lord Shiva.
review: This is one of the ancient temples devoted to Lord Shiva. The shivlinga is covered by the silver metal and was founded by Lord Shiva himself.
